para.text: between two points in a survey is the theoretical error variance of the final estimated displacement between those points when the survey is subjected to a least-squares adjustment. For a survey consisting of a single traverse between the points, the network variance is simply the sum of variances assigned to vectors. For cases involving loops, the computation is more involved since a portion of the inverted "normal coefficient" matrix must be obtained. Network variances can be used with the UVE and loop count to obtain "confidence intervals" and statistics useful for data screening.
